utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So what brings you to the clinic today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi so I just like for I don't know like three or four days I’ve been having this really dry cough and my throat feels really scratchy. I just feel kinda crappy overall. And my head’s pounding

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Your heads pounding. You have a headache right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, little bit. I just kind of feel just icky.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and you say I've been feeling that for three to four days now.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah exactly

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What did you first notice?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I first noticed that my throat was kind of scratchy and then I started coughing, but it's really like dry.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you haven't been bringing anything up with it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No,

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any flem?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: no nothing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, you haven't been noticing been running a temperature at home. Have you hot fevers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have felt really hot.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: You felt hot at home, OK,

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: yeah,

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: You noticed any night sweats by night sweats. I mean you wake up sheets are soaked.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I honestly I felt hot like all the time like yeah yeah night. I feel hot but during the day too I'm just like I'm I'm like hey I'm wearing like just shorts and like a tank top and I just still feel really hot.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. You notice, skin changes anything in your arms or legs it looks weird? New rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't. I don't think so. I haven't really been looking, but you know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No worries and then aside from that, any nausea? Any vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that. No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any aches in your joints anywhere?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No. I mean, I'm I'm tired, but I don't think they're not like hurting.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so aside that aside from kind of this dry cough feeling hot that otherwise you're feeling OK. You don't have any other real concerns aside from that.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, just like I just feel crappy like. Yeah, I really. I don't think I know that's not like a a real like way to say.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh no, no, it's perfectly valid. We called that Malays in general. Just feeling a little bit off. Alright so this is going to talk about you for a little bit, but first, we'll get to that later. So any issues that you've seen a doctor for before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have I have allergies. Usually in like the spring in the fall.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you have any allergies to any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no nothing like that. It's just like I get, really bad allergies like I I've seen an allergist and some years I've gotten allergy shots. But like not every year. Otherwise, I'll take like Claritin. This isn't like this is maybe around like this is just before they normally start, so I don't really have them right now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Probably like in a few weeks they'd be really bad.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Now do any of these allergies can't make it difficult to breathe or you feel like your face is swelling up?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh. Like it feels like a little bit like plugged up an like what's that called like post nasal drip? But I don't really feel like I can't breathe.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: It's just like a little stuffy.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah, exactly.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And these shots at the allergist gave you, how often would you get those?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Those are the ones that I'd have like once. Usually like once a week for a little while, like in the winter before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you don't carry an EpiPen with you.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, they said it's not like one of those allergies and it's just like it's just like the seasonal ones. But they're just bad.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, sounds good. So you've seen an allergist. Any other doctors that you've seen in your life?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My family doctor. I don’t really go very often.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, has there been any health issues that you've had in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, like I've been really healthy. It's just like the allergies and.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any surgeries in your life?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. Are you takin any medications right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I take. Claritin for allergies but I haven't like right now. I just have it with me just in case. I take birth control.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What type of birth control do you take?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Deyo

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and you take that regularly?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's just like the pill. It's like the one that goes for three months.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you don't have an IUD now you just take the oral contraception?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah yeah, just the pill got it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Got it. OK and then so you never had asthma in your life?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any family history of asthma?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like my cousin.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, what about your parents, brothers, sisters?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you know what eczema is?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like, I've heard of it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, anyone in the family have it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No. Like the only thing, like my dad has allergies too. Same kind as me.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK . Dad has allergies. OK, mother and father still alive?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Healthy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK good, do you live with them right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah, like I'm in high school.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK so you live in a house with both your parents. OK any brothers sisters?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah I have a little brother.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How old’s he?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like 14 now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Has anyone in the family been sick recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think my brother we had like a cold a few weeks ago

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: He had a cold.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: But like we are doing our school from home now so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Got it.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My mom works from home and my dad just works like on the farm so. So no one's been like seeing anyone or going anywhere to get sick.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so sorry, do you live on a farm?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah,

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, in London?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like just outside.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any travel or anywhere recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, like I just just came here. But like I don't really leave the house

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So last last two weeks you haven't left the country?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I wish.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: You keep any animals on the farm?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: We have like a dog, but it's not like an animal farm

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Got it. OK, another questions, are you sexually active?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: But you're taking the birth control? OK, so when was your last menstrual period?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like like I just got done like a week ago.. A week ago. And you haven't been sexually active since then.. No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. So chances of being pregnant very low.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh Oh yeah yeah, it's been like a year.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Got it got it alright, do you smoke? Cigarettes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like before Covid, when I saw my friends like sometimes a little bit but like not really anymore.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how much would you drink when you went out?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh like, I mean, our parents would sometimes let us have like a couple coolers, but like that, was it?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Got it. Any other drugs? Marijuana, cocaine?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like I tried marijuana once at a party like a couple years ago, but like I had, I never did it again.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Got it so none of the harder drugs, cocaine, heroin?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And I gotta ask this question for everyone. Have you ever injected drugs or anything into your arm or your body?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright, thanks Jessica. So just to summarize, you kind of had a three to four day dry cough with a little bit of fever, some headache, and just in terms was quickly reviewing then. So you have been bringing anything up. No one in contact with these recently been sick. You don't have asthma, your not taking any medications aside from Claritin, and your little brother might have been sick about two weeks ago with kind of a common cold and we're hoping to get out of this visit is just kind of next steps and where to go from here, correct?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, like, I just want to know if I have to like take medicine or something.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright perfect Thank you very much. You have any more questions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't know. I don't have any more questions. I just like I can go home soon like lay down.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
